relation: ABC system with Intel® Core™2 Solo processor
PC based on Core™ Solo 2 processor
pageTitle: Usage Guidelines for Customers, Licensees, and Other Third Parties
textBeforeTable: Sample Usage Chart Processor number font, size, and color must be treated the same as the rest of the brand text mention. For products with an assigned processor number, the processor number must follow the processor brand name (e.g., Intel® Core™2 Solo processor U2200). It’s an Intel Legal mandate to include the Intel mark because this is a unitary trademark with Intel as an integral part of the whole trademark; thus, Intel MUST always be used in the mark (e.g., the entire trademark is “Intel® Core™”) Never incorporate Intel® Core™2 Solo trademark or any part of the trademark into third party’s company name, product brand name, or model number. Never hyphenate or abbreviate Intel® Core™2 Solo trademark. Always capitalize the word Solo. Always have a space between “CORE” and “2”, such as Intel® Core™2 Solo processor, where the ™ is the space or Intel Core 2 Solo processor when no ™ is used. Use the trademark symbol in the first appearance of the trademark in a headline, and/or the first prominent use, and first appearance in the body of text. The appropriate use of trademark symbols with this trademark is as follows: Intel® Core™2 Solo processor. No trademark symbol
